title: On the embedding of Galois groups into wreath products
summary: In this paper we make explicit an application of the wreath product construction to the Galois groups of field extensions.

title: A nonlinear relapse model with disaggregated contact rates: analysis of a forward-backward bifurcation
summary: We developed a nonlinear differential equation model to explore the dynamics of relapse phenomena. Our incidence rate function is formulated, taking inspiration from recent adaptive algorithms.

title: Source-Sink Dynamics in a Two-Patch SI Epidemic Model with Life Stages and No Recovery from Infection
summary: This study presents a comprehensive analysis of a two-patch, two-life stage SI model without recovery from infection, focusing on the dynamics of disease spread and host population viability in natural populations.

title: Interplay between Foraging Choices and Population Growth Dynamics
summary: In this study, we couple a population dynamics model with a model for optimal foraging to study the interdependence between individual-level cost-benefits and population-scale dynamics.

title: Emil Artin's thesis and the genesis of the Weil conjectures
summary: Exploration of Emil Artin's 1924 thesis as the origin of the famous Artin Conjectures. We offer a review of the historical work on the theory of algebraic function fields by E.Artin and F.K. Schmidt.

title: Basic Classification Algorithms in Machine Learning (Mathematical Foundations)
summary: After taking a first course on Machine Learning fundamentals, I decided to do a small compendium of the mathematical definitions behind the most famous classification algorithms in Supervised and Unsupervised Learning.

title: Extensions of Torsors and prime to p fundamental group scheme
summary: This is my master's thesis for my Pure Mathematics Masters at the University of Costa Rica. Thesis is in Spanish.
